intro: Spergularia remotiflora, commonly known as sea sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish to white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in sandy or salt-laden soils, often found in dunes and coastal grasslands. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Spergularia remotiflora plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
